page.title: 01Cheshunt gazetteer
page.content: Cheshunt is 20 km north of the centre of London and lies to the west of the River Lea.Cheshunt is in easy reach of London with good road connections, such as the A10 and rail links to Liverpool Street Station. The urban area is increasing all the time,with new housing estates being built on the edge of Cheshunt.A number of people that live here are commuters, but there is an industrial estate,shops and offices which offer employment. Tesco is the main employer of the area with its head office located here. Since 1965 the Lea Valley has been a country park serving the people of Greater London.The park is used for recreation such as fishing and walking. To the east of the park lies the Hertfordshire and Essex border.The land here is used for mixed farming and nurseries.
